name: culpably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows that someone deserves to be blamed or considered responsible for something bad: He culpably neglected his duty by failing to report the shooting. They haven't actually done anything culpably wrong. See
culpable
More examplesFewer examplesShe was unsympathetic and, more culpably, got some facts wrong. His mother didn't correct James, however culpably he behaved.The government is culpably negligent if it allows inappropriate carers to work with children.
